definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)

sentences.english: Don't tuck the napkin in your vest or put it under chin like a baby's bib.
sentences.chinese: 不要把餐巾塞入馬甲或圍在下顎像嬰兒的圍兜。

sentences.english: Don't tuck it into your belt or use it as bib.
sentences.chinese: 不要把它塞在你的皮帶裏，或是將其當圍兜用。

sentences.english: The baby's name is on the bib.
For your bag with the diapers, some clothes and a bib .
sentences.chinese: 爲了您的尿布袋，一些衣服和一個圍兜。

sentences.english: May I tie on your bib?
sentences.chinese: 我可以替您繫上圍兜嗎？

sentences.english: The leak-proof bib you'll hate to toss.
sentences.chinese: 這個防漏圍兜您將不願意拋。
嬰兒已經把圍兜弄溼了。

sentences.english: Someone who loves me very much went to NEW YORK and got me this Bib.
sentences.chinese: 一個非常愛我的人去了趟紐約，並帶給我這個圍兜兜。

sentences.english: Our company supply baby bib, a large quantity favorably, welcome to the consultation to discuss.
sentences.chinese: 本公司供應嬰兒圍兜，量大從優，歡迎前來諮詢洽談。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a disposable hairdressing apron.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型是一種一次性使用的理髮圍兜。

sentences.english: The baby is wearing a bib.
